tool_description: Price Tracking and Dynamic Pricing Software
name: Prisync
title: Prisync

api_list.name: List all products in your account
api_list.description: This endpoint returns information about the products that have been added to Prisync via web UI or the API. The result is paginated. Each page contains up to 100 products.

required_parameters.name: startFrom
required_parameters.description: Offset for pagination. It can take 0 and exact multiples of 100 as a value.

api_list.name: Get a specific category
api_list.description: This endpoint returns category info with given id.  Tip You can get the id of a Category using /get/category/name/{name} request.

api_list.name: Get a specific URL
api_list.description: This endpoint returns URL info with given id.   Tip: When you want to get all URLs belonging to a particular product, first you should make a request for getting the details of the product (See get product.). That request will return an array of URL id's in the response. Using those URL id's, you can get exact URL (the actual address) using this endpoint.

api_list.name: List all products in your account with price information
api_list.description: This endpoint returns information about the products including price information that have been added to Prisync via web UI or the API. The result is paginated. Each page contains up to 100 products.

required_parameters.name: startFrom
required_parameters.description: Offset for pagination. It can take 0 and exact multiples of 100 as a value.

api_list.name: Get a particular product
api_list.description: This endpoint returns product info with given id.

api_list.name: Returns account info
api_list.description: This endpoint returns your account details.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://prisync.p.rapidapi.com/account"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "prisync.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

api_list.name: List all brands in the store
api_list.description: This endpoint returns list of your brands. The response is paginated and it can show 100 brands at a time.

required_parameters.name: startFrom
required_parameters.description: Offset for pagination. It can take 0 and exact multiples of 100 as a value.   P.S.: Actually, startFrom is an optional parameter. When not provided, this method returns the first page only. So that, calling without startFrom is equivalent to startFrom/0.

api_list.name: Get status of a batch import
api_list.description: This endpoint returns progress status of batch import product.  /add/batch request works asynchronously which means it returns success immediately, then it adds all the products into a buffer queue, and finally it saves products into Prisync database. You can query this endpoint to get current status of your bulk add.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://prisync.p.rapidapi.com/progress/batchImport"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "prisync.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: List all categories in the store
api_list.description: This endpoint returns list of your categories. The response is paginated and it can show 100 categories at a time.

required_parameters.name: startFrom
required_parameters.description: Offset for pagination. It can take 0 and exact multiples of 100 as a value.   P.S.: Actually, startFrom is an optional parameter. When not provided, this method returns the first page only. So that, calling without startFrom is equivalent to startFrom/0.

api_list.name: Get a specific brand
api_list.description: This endpoint returns brand info with given id.  Tip You can get the id of a Brand using /get/brand/name/{name} request.
